trans-unit.source: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its URL.
This class cannot be inherited.
The complete URL is considered, including the protocol (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP) and the file.
For example, http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/grind.htm is a complete URL.
URLs can be matched exactly or by a wildcard in the final position.
For example, http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/* is a wildcard URL.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition"></xref> class with the URL that determines membership.
The complete URL is considered, including the protocol (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP) and the file, for example: http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/grind.htm.
URLs can be matched exactly or by a wildcard in the final position, for example: http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/*.
The URL for which to test.
The url parameter is .
url must be an absolute URL.
Determines whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
This membership condition tests only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Url> evidence object.
The evidence set against which to make the test.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition.Url*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.
A new, identical copy of the current membership condition.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition.Url*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the URL from the specified object is equivalent to the URL contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition"></xref>.
The object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the URL from the specified object is equivalent to the URL contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition.Url*> property of the current object or the specified object is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The e parameter is .
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The policy level context, used to resolve named permission set references.
The e parameter is .
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Gets the hash code for the current membership condition.
The hash code for the current membership condition.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition.Url*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Creates and returns a string representation of the membership condition.
A string representation of the state of the membership condition.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition.Url*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state with the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref>.
The policy level context for resolving named permission set references.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.UrlMembershipCondition.Url*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the URL for which the membership condition tests.
The complete URL is considered, including the protocol (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP) and the file.
For example, http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/grind.htm is a complete URL.
URLs can be matched exactly or by a wildcard in the final position.
For example, http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/* is a wildcard URL.
The URL for which the membership condition tests.
An attempt is made to set Url to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Value is not an absolute URL.
